24101.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"51doc","text":"Insert large cassette into the machine ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4m0e7","text":"Configure X, Y, and Z settings for the multiwell plate by clicking on tool symbol -\u003e stage alignment.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"161a0","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"54ihu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ekfnd","text":"For UNIPLATE96SQWLF 650U:","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1ka4l","text":"\n","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"b3cpf","text":"X = 95.6","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1t6n","text":"Y = 4.2","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1c5oj","text":"Z = -22.5","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cimvt","text":"\n","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ao756","text":"For 48WP:","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"A6DDC0D1C24A44B2B2BFB9F33059154E"}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"408bt","text":"Exit settings by pressing the back button","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ed30p","text":"Press on the program you wish to use (see later for configuring your own program)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"devtr","text":"Make sure that the correct cassette is listed and change if necessary","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2jpm6","text":"Select the volume you wish to dispense","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"urjb","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"11hld","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9a5eh","text":"For 96WP:","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"53qop","text":"150 Î¼L","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5gusm","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"B07A8121822E40D68BD8FD09A5FA1C05"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"33vs9","text":"Prepare a 250ml bottle of hot milliQ water in the microwave and keep in the waterbath along with the agar. The water is important to have on hand in case of tubing blockages.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7vkc8","text":"Put the plate into the stage and then press 'Move' so that the plate moves so that it is under the dispensing cassette. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b8cum","text":"Use the up and down arrows to move the pipette tip so that they hover just over the plate and make note of the height (this will be entered into the dispensing program at a later step). Press 'Fast/Slow' button to switch between fast and slow movements.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fjhcv","text":"Use the X, Y arrows to move the plate so that the pipette tips are centered in the middle of column 5.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dp8b9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"cqqpg","text":"Save all settings.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c3cuh","text":"Place the end of the tubing from the casettee into the agar that is being kept warm in the water bath","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5shbd","text":"Press 'Prime' to prime the tubing and allow to finish so that agar flows from the pipette tips.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7ers0","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"eflmm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2qvfo","text":"IMPORTANT:","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"j6hg","text":"Once the agar is in the tubing it is important to act quickly to avoid agar solidifying and causing blockages. If you are particularly concerned about agar cooling in the tubing, wrap the tubing in aluminium foil to keep hot.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"62901AC305B2492EBBE3C621A69A2D54"}}}}

cases.title: Unblocking the tubing
cases.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"5j1a2","text":"If the tubing does block, clear the blockage by 'reverse priming' as much of the agar as possible.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3v61","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1dpkc","text":"Then place tube ends in the hot water and prime continuously with hot water until the water runs all the way through.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b05rb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ceof","text":"If you are having trouble getting the water through, squeeze and massage parts of the tubing where you can see blockages to force the agar along and allow the water to pass.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a5sme","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"r489","text":"Once all cleared, 'reverse prime', and reprime with the agar","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

24101.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"f5i8r","text":"Select 'set height' and set the appropriate height for tip height (usually all the same)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"86cme","text":"Place a clean plate in the stage","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ej3s","text":"Press run and then plate should fill with agar","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9o0bu","text":"Repeat steps 11-12 until all the plates have been filled.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"97j18","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"25sir","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"c4eh","text":"Little drops of agar can solidify on the tip ends. It is often good to remove these drops using a pipette tip every few runs so that blockages do not occur. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"1F040B0FCB02461C95157A10E84A3BAE"}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"83lh","text":"'Reverse prime' all the agar","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"1tkvv","text":"Place the tubing ends into the hot water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"2qk6v","text":"Prime so that the water runs through and clears all the agar","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"fhse3","text":"Reverse prime to remove the water","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7dvv5","text":"Release tension from the tubing and remove cassette","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8vp46","text":"Double wrap the cassette in aluminium foil for autoclaving","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

29207.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fm6uj","text":"Obtain LB Broth from the Media kitchen","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"817ee","text":"LB Broth contents:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7k94l","text":"4 g NaCl","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"234vn","text":"4 g Tryptone","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bf8pp","text":"2 g Yeast Extract","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fvoqg","text":"dH2O to 400 mL","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":2,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8mtd7","text":"Add liquid LB to a tube or flask and add the appropriate antibiotic (if required) to the correct concentration (see table below).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"43opf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e1cur","text":"Antibiotic ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":4,"length":25},{"style":"bold","offset":34,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"ormh","text":"Note: {"blocks":[{"key":"9qml6","text":"Using a sterile inoculation loop, select a single colony from your bacteria streaked LB agar plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"36b3c","text":"Dip the inoculation loop into the liquid LB and swirl.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7v4vj","text":"Discard the inoculation loop.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ets20","text":"Loosely cover the culture with sterile aluminium foil or a cap that is not air tight as bacteria needs air.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2fs0c","text":"Incubate the bacterial culture at the required growth temperature overnight (i.e. 12-18 hrs in general) in a shaking incubator.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1qs89","text":"After incubation, check for growth, which is characterized by a cloudy haze in the media.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9lfjb","text":"Measure the optical density of the bacterial culture at 600nm wavelength using a spectrophotometer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8pct0","text":"Record the OD600 three times and calculate average, use LB Broth as Blank.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

47319.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"32sek","text":"Obtain LB Broth from the Media kitchen ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1drvd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2460o","text":"LB Broth contents: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dnebh","text":"4gNaCl","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"v0f3","text":"4 g Tryptone","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3i257","text":"2 g Yeast Extract ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"au4dc","text":"Add dH2O to 400 mL ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ej3f","text":"Wipe the work area with 70% ethanol and create a sterile environment on the laboratory bench by using a bunsen or gas burner. Work under the hood if you have a large number of plates. Book the hood in advance in that case.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2viqr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ltgj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"12l7b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"baa2t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"biam4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1nqq5","text":"Label the inoculation plates and the lids with the corresponding frozen library plate ID","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3j252","text":"Add 200Î¼l liquid LB to each well of the 96-well plate using a multichannel pipette and a sterile reservoir. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6jvfd","text":"Details of the plates used:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7re9c","text":"Name: ThermoFisher Scientific Nuncâ¢ 96-Well Polystyrene Round Bottom Microwell Plates, Non-Treated","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"16ri8","text":"Catalogue number: 268200","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":18,"length":6}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"8FC5280A704E11EB94660A58A9FEAC2A","url":"https://www.thermofisher.com/order/catalog/product/268200"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"60pmi","text":"Take the frozen library plates out of the freezer just before doing the inoculation to avoid the wells thawing completely (We want to avoid repetitive freeze thawing of the bacterial strains). You can also use dry ice to take all the plates out of the freezer at once. In that case, just before inoculation take the respective plate off the dry ice and leave on bench top for 2mins","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4fv62","text":"Position the plates so that well A1 of every plate is at the top left. You can also put sticker on the replicator to mark A1 and H12, to avoid confusion and contamination","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6kcqt","text":"To use the replicator, strap some laboratory/masking tape around your index and middle finger together with the adhesive part on the outer side. Use the stickiness of the tape to pick up the replicator by gently pressing on the surface ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7eudg","text":"Carefully lower the sterile replicator into the frozen library plate, making sure to touch the surface or puncture into the frozen wells to obtain sufficient bacterial cells","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8edjj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"68stk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"brlem","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2cbv3","text":"Move the replicator immediately over to the inoculation plate containing LB and Kanamycin and dip the replicator into the liquid (try to swirl the replicator slightly while inside the wells to ensure the bacteria mixes with the liquid)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"67qdn","text":"Wash the replicator with ethanol and then with water, and place inside an autoclavable box to be sterilised for later use (use a new replicator for every inoculation plate to avoid contamination)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6elre","text":"Cover the inoculation plates with plastic lids and wrap in a damp tissue. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6qnjm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"anhou","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bfkcl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8cni3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"783um","text":"Place the bacterial cultures in an airtight box (to prevent evaporation from the wells) and incubate overnight at 37Â°C (no shaking).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b8nsd","text":"After incubation, check for growth, which is characterized by a cloudy haze in the media","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2r2kp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"23qtv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

47321.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"309bv","text":" Book the autoclave (notebook on top of the machine).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8jj73","text":" Take clean flasks from the glass kitchen.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1djq8","text":" Measure all the pre-autoclave reagents and add to the flask (Use a new weighing boat and spatula for each reagent. Also, the cholesterol is kept in the fridge.)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"du0k","text":" Once water is added mix thoroughly and label with autoclave tape (âNGM Rm 5020â). Make sure the bottle is not screwed completely when placing it inside the autoclave machine.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"d1upm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3n4ll","text":"     - Turn ON the autoclave","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5hcii","text":"     - Make sure that the autoclaveâs probe bottle is the same size as the largest bottle you use and fill it with water. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6m9aj","text":"     - Place the temperature probe in it.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"64o03","text":"     - Fill up the autoclave with water until it reaches the grill.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e2tak","text":"     - Place the bottles in the autoclave and make sure that the cap is not screwed completely.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"15kuc","text":"     - Check the waste flask is not too full","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f30mb","text":"     - Use âmediaâ program. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3da1n","text":"     - Press START.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9b3ll","text":"     - It will take about 2 hours for a 500ml bottle to autoclave and about 2.5 hours for 1L or larger bottles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3or95","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"do41r","text":" When autoclave is complete, remove the probe flask ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9f79r","text":" Make sure to wear gloves as the flask will be hot","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fe27u","text":" Let the agar to cool to around 55Â°C, ie the bottle is cool enough to hold for a second with a gloved hand.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"rb6n","text":" Add the post autoclave reagents.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3iou4","text":" Mix it well and start pouring onto imaging plates following the Protocol for Plate Pouring.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":78,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6qt0f","text":"Try not to shake the bottle too much while mixing to avoid air bubbles.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7v7q2","text":"The agar needs to be warm to be poured without blocking the tubings, so try to pour as quickly as possible and if not poured immediately put the bottle on a waterbath set to 60C until being used.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

47335.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1usv2","text":"Leave the Falcon tube to stand for a while until the worm settle to the bottom in a loose pellet. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2av71","text":"Add 350Î¼L bleach mix to the 2mL solution of worms in M9","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7jfp0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"qmhk","text":"Wash worms off the plates with a few mL of M9 buffer into a 15mL Falcon tube. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7mps2","text":"Mix together in an Eppendorf tube:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c3cn9","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6ep24","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fj5uv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"400","error":false,"guid":"0DDD5530709111EB96968141F1145020","id":0,"label":"NaOH [4M]","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"350","error":false,"guid":"1D01FB10709111EB96968141F1145020","id":0,"label":"Sodium Hypochlorite [Acros Organics, 10/15% active chlorine, 7681-52-9]","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5p10d","text":"Remove the supernatant leaving 2mL M9 solution in the tube (with the worms pelleted)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dj7qo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a1ufj","text":"Vortex for 5 min (checking every 30 seconds under a microscope to see if the worms are broken apart and eggs have been released).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ar6md","text":"Once the majority of eggs have been released, quench the solution by topping up the Falcon tube to 14mL with M9. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cr54","text":"Centrifuge at 6700 rpm for 2 minutes to pellet the eggs to the bottom.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"dcs42","text":"Carefully remove the supernatant using a plastic Pasteur pipette. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"124sm","text":"Top up the Falcon tube to 14mL with M9. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ae79f","text":"Repeat Steps 8 - 10 three more times, to thoroughly quench the bleach solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9fsnp","text":"After the final wash, top up to 10mL with M9.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4kauh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6c65h","text":"Using a glass Pasteur pipette, remove as much supernatant as possible, and then pool all L1 worms together into a single Eppendorf tube. {"blocks":[{"key":"d5d6","text":"Inoculate 10ml LB broth media with E. coli BW25113 (Keio background wild-type strain, used as negative control and for raising worms, no Kanamycin) in an Erlenmeyer flask for overnight culture following the protocol: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":35,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8mhlu","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cpgfj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"protocols","mutability":"","data":{"id":29207,"title":"Inoculating a Liquid Bacterial Culture","title_html":"\u003cp\u003eInoculating a Liquid Bacterial Culture\u003c/p\u003e","load_collapsed":true,"uri":"inoculating-a-liquid-bacterial-culture-8rxhv7n","image":{"source":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_source":null,"placeholder":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_placeholder":null},"creator":{"name":"Priota Islam","affiliation":"Imperial College London","affiliation_url":"http://behave.lms.mrc.ac.uk/","username":"priota-islam","link":"https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Priota_Islam","image":{"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/pr-journal/86b3npn.jpg","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/pr-journal/86b3npn.jpg","webp_source":""}},"stats":{"number_of_steps":14},"type_id":1,"guid":"7481BF80487011EC882E05372C908EE5"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cvr3l","text":"Fill all wells of the 10 culture plates with 200Î¼L LB broth media. Add 50Î¼g/ml Kanamycin to all wells except the wells for the wild-type BW25113 control strain. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6su0j","text":"Remove the imaging plates from 4Â°C storage and record the average weight of 3 randomly selected plates","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"18r21","text":"(Friday)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"84gd1","text":"Prior to tracking, ensure that the imaging cave air conditioning is turned on (and there has not been a power-cut) and also empty the dehumidifier waste water tray (see pre-imaging checklist)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2ato8","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dbg0j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"safety","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7p8ia","text":"Normal temperature range: 19 - 21Â°C","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5qthm","text":"Humidity: 35 - 45%","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4jseg","text":"Make 1L normal Nematode Growth Media (NGM) agar, following the protocol:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f51k1","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"60m1l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"protocols","mutability":"","data":{"id":47321,"title":"Making normal NGM for imaging plates (Cabreiro Lab)","title_html":"\u003cp\u003eMaking normal NGM for imaging plates (Cabreiro Lab)\u003c/p\u003e","load_collapsed":true,"uri":"making-normal-ngm-for-imaging-plates-cabreiro-lab-bsfznbp6","image":{"source":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_source":null,"placeholder":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_placeholder":null},"creator":{"name":"Saul   Moore","affiliation":null,"affiliation_url":null,"username":"saul---moore","link":null,"image":{"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/public/f73577561f86bbe233b0a4ec1c086797e859f8e5c9bf0fcbf1ee27b9af38e967/br323npw.jpg","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/public/f73577561f86bbe233b0a4ec1c086797e859f8e5c9bf0fcbf1ee27b9af38e967/br323npw.jpg","webp_source":""}},"stats":{"number_of_steps":3},"type_id":1,"guid":"05F641F0486E11EC882E05372C908EE5"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3dmm4","text":"Using the Integra ViaFill, dispense 200Î¼L of NGM agar into each well of the 10 imaging plates, following the protocol: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7blsn","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1e0fk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"protocols","mutability":"","data":{"id":24101,"title":"Dispensing agar into multiwell plates","title_html":"Dispensing agar into multiwell plates","load_collapsed":true,"uri":"dispensing-agar-into-multiwell-plates-3sdgna6","image":{"source":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_source":null,"placeholder":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_placeholder":null},"creator":{"name":"Ida Barlow","affiliation":null,"affiliation_url":null,"username":"ida-barlow","link":null,"image":{"source":"/img/avatars/011.png","placeholder":"/img/avatars/011.png","webp_source":""}},"stats":{"number_of_steps":23},"type_id":1,"guid":"53C00BA0486E11EC882E05372C908EE5"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2021h","text":"Leave the plates on the lab bench (with lids on) until the agar has cooled and solidified (approximately 1 hour, timing depends on humidity)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"oogq","text":"Measure the weight of 3 imaging plates (with lids on) and record average plate weight on day of pouring","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1dbmb","text":"Dry the imaging plates under a hood (or drying cabinet) until the plates lose between 3-5% of their original plate weight (with lids on)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2cu89","text":"Store the imaging plates upside-down at 4Â°C until used for experiments","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"elsms","text":"Pour 20ml NGM agar into each maintenance plate, and 50ml NGM agar into each nursery plate, following the protocol for Plate pouring (dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.6bhhaj6). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":133,"length":40}],"data":{}},{"key":"al04n","text":"Keep the remaining agar warm in a water bath set to 65Â°C, for dispensing into 96-well imaging plates afterwards","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"719B7641486F11EC91300A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.6bhhaj6"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a7te7","text":"Place the inoculation in a shaking incubator at 37Â°C at 200 rpm and leave to grow overnight","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f9tob","text":"Remove the BW culture from the shaking incubator and place in 4Â°C fridge until seeding","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cqdlu","text":"Remove the plates from storage and the BW culture from the fridge, and leave on the bench for approximately 30 minutes to acclimate to room temperature","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dt9mi","text":"Using aseptic technique, seed the maintenance plates each with 400Î¼L of BW25113 culture","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"49qfh","text":"On the day of tracking, remove the seeded imaging plates from 4Â°C, and dry for 30 minutes under a hood","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3shhl","text":"(Tuesday)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"vl0r","text":"Leave under hood until dry (with lids on, timing depends on humidity)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ekhmt","text":"Using a platinum pick, gently pick 30 adult N2 Bristol C. elegans onto each maintenance plate, and store in an incubator at 20Â°C (Monday)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":55,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9s2d1","text":"After 24 hours, remove the adult worms, leaving the eggs behind to hatch into L1 larvae (Tuesday)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ct36v","text":"Inoculate a further 10ml LB broth media with BW25113 bacteria for overnight culture, following the protocol in   and place in a shaking incubator at 37Â°C, 200 rpm (Wednesday)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":111,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7eupr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"gotostep","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"703A1FE04EB411EC882E05372C908EE5","id":0,"step_guid":"34B5C130486B11EC882E05372C908EE5","title":""}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aj1ra","text":"After 24 hours, remove the culture from the incubator, and the nursery plates from storage, and leave to acclimate on bench top for 30 minutes (Thursday)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cj3hb","text":"Seed the nursery plates each with 1mL of fresh BW25113 culture. Leave under hood until dry","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"hve9","text":"Wash the worms off the BW-seeded maintenance plates, into two 15ml Falcon tubes (Friday)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"76ukg","text":"Perform an egg prep on worms in the Falcon tubes, following the protocol: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"97c8i","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dmm9h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"protocols","mutability":"","data":{"id":47335,"title":"Egg Prep   forÂ Bleach Synchronization (Cabreiro Lab)","title_html":"\u003cp\u003eEgg Prep   forÂ Bleach Synchronization (Cabreiro Lab)\u003c/p\u003e","load_collapsed":true,"uri":"egg-prep-for-bleach-synchronization-cabreiro-lab-bsgfnbtn","image":{"source":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_source":null,"placeholder":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_placeholder":null},"creator":{"name":"Saul   Moore","affiliation":null,"affiliation_url":null,"username":"saul---moore","link":null,"image":{"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/public/f73577561f86bbe233b0a4ec1c086797e859f8e5c9bf0fcbf1ee27b9af38e967/br323npw.jpg","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/public/f73577561f86bbe233b0a4ec1c086797e859f8e5c9bf0fcbf1ee27b9af38e967/br323npw.jpg","webp_source":""}},"stats":{"number_of_steps":18},"type_id":1,"guid":"C0798B80487411EC882E05372C908EE5"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5d2tm","text":"At around noon the next day, wash L1 larvae off the empty plate and re-feed onto the BW-seeded nursery plates using a glass Pasteur pipette. Aim to dispense around 1000 worms per plate. Incubate at 20Â°C (Saturday)    ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"37kfo","text":"Remove the required stock plates from -80Â°C containing the strains for antioxidant testing. Gently remove the aluminium film and leave to partially thaw for a minute or so","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eblsg","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8i6h4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"safety","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4gngh","text":"To avoid damaging the bacterial stocks through repeated freeze-thawing, do not let the wells completely defrost. {"blocks":[{"key":"9etov","text":"Inoculate individual vials, containing 4mL LB broth and 50Î¼g/ml Kanamycin, with the desired strains for antioxidant testing from Keio frozen stock plates, following the protocol:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7cis6","text":"(Tuesday) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7mf1r","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"c8r1a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"protocols","mutability":"","data":{"id":29207,"title":"Inoculating a Liquid Bacterial Culture","title_html":"\u003cp\u003eInoculating a Liquid Bacterial Culture\u003c/p\u003e","load_collapsed":true,"uri":"inoculating-a-liquid-bacterial-culture-8rxhv7n","image":{"source":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_source":null,"placeholder":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_placeholder":null},"creator":{"name":"Priota Islam","affiliation":"Imperial College London","affiliation_url":"http://behave.lms.mrc.ac.uk/","username":"priota-islam","link":"https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Priota_Islam","image":{"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/pr-journal/86b3npn.jpg","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/pr-journal/86b3npn.jpg","webp_source":""}},"stats":{"number_of_steps":14},"type_id":1,"guid":"A827A3E04EB511EC882E05372C908EE5"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"flfic","text":"Optional: Make a template stock plate for -80Â°C storage with the strain layout desired: mix 200Î¼L culture with 15% glycerol in each well","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fvjhm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bch96","text":"Remove the overnight cultures from the incubator. Again, fill the wells of 10 culture plates with 200Î¼L LB broth. But this time do not add Kanamycin. Inoculate the second round of overnight cultures from the first, using a 96-pin replicator, following the protocol: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ifs1","text":"(Thursday)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7k26a","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5mani","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"protocols","mutability":"","data":{"id":47319,"title":"Growing overnight bacterial culture in 96WP (Cabreiro Lab)","title_html":"\u003cp\u003eGrowing overnight bacterial culture in 96WP (Cabreiro Lab)\u003c/p\u003e","load_collapsed":true,"uri":"growing-overnight-bacterial-culture-in-96wp-cabrei-bsfxnbpn","image":{"source":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_source":null,"placeholder":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_placeholder":null},"creator":{"name":"Saul   Moore","affiliation":null,"affiliation_url":null,"username":"saul---moore","link":null,"image":{"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/public/f73577561f86bbe233b0a4ec1c086797e859f8e5c9bf0fcbf1ee27b9af38e967/br323npw.jpg","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/public/f73577561f86bbe233b0a4ec1c086797e859f8e5c9bf0fcbf1ee27b9af38e967/br323npw.jpg","webp_source":""}},"stats":{"number_of_steps":13},"type_id":1,"guid":"8CFAE8204EBA11EC882E05372C908EE5"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5v592","text":"Ensure that imaging plates have lost approximately 3-5% of their original weight. Place under a hood or drying cabinet until they have","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d8hn5","text":"Remove overnight cultures of Keio strains from 4Â°C storage. Using the Integra ViaFlo, seed 10Î¼l of bacterial culture from the wells of each overnight culture plate into the corresponding wells of each imaging plate","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4tfsc","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6f4dv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"safety","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5tf88","text":"Ensure correct plate orientation under the Integra ViaFlo, with well A1 in the top left corner","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d72nq","text":"Place seeded plates under a hood to dry for 20 minutes, then place in an incubator at 25Â°C (no shaking) for 7 hours 40 minutes (total lawn growth time: 8 hours)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b10u5","text":"After 8 hours, remove the plates from the incubator and store at 4Â°C","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6e1d8","text":"Leave to dry under a hood for a further 30 minutes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"83ku1","text":"Using the Integra ViaFlo, dispense 7Î¼L of antioxidant solution from the prepared treatment plate into each well of 10 imaging plates","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fmq64","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2nahb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"safety","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"822dt","text":"Ensure correct plate orientation under the Integra ViaFlo, with well A1 in the top left corner!","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6cpa6","text":"Remove the nursery plates from the incubator. Wash the worms off the plates into two 15ml Falcon tubes using approximately 10mL sterile PBS 'A' buffer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"assl8","text":"Fill up the tubes to 15ml with PBS 'A' and centrifuge at 1000rpm for 2 minutes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"58uag","text":"Remove the supernatant using a Pasteur pipette","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d3h2f","text":"Repeat steps    to    four more times to thoroughly rinse off any remaining control BW25113 bacteria","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":13,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":19,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"gotostep","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"72991DD0487A11EC882E05372C908EE5","id":0,"step_guid":"3863FE50487A11EC882E05372C908EE5","title":""}},"1":{"type":"gotostep","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"782D2FC0487A11EC882E05372C908EE5","id":0,"step_guid":"493C95C0487A11EC882E05372C908EE5","title":""}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8j1i9","text":"Re-suspend the worms and divide them equally into two 50ml Falcon tubes (for the COPAS), and fill them both up to approximately 40ml with PBS 'A'","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dtg93","text":"Use the COPAS to dispense three Day1 adult worms into each well of the 10 imaging plates, following the protocol: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1r3np","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ah9nu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"protocols","mutability":"","data":{"id":50531,"title":"COPAS wormsorter v.2","title_html":"\u003cp\u003eCOPAS wormsorter v.2\u003c/p\u003e","load_collapsed":true,"uri":"copas-wormsorter-v-2-bvkbn4sn","image":{"source":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_source":null,"placeholder":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_placeholder":null},"creator":{"name":"Bonnie Evans","affiliation":null,"affiliation_url":null,"username":"bonnie-evans","link":"","image":{"source":"/img/avatars/013.png","placeholder":"/img/avatars/013.png","webp_source":""}},"stats":{"number_of_steps":66},"type_id":1,"guid":"13E5B040487B11EC882E05372C908EE5"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a8ikv","text":"Leave the plates to dry under a hood for 30 minutes to 1 hour (until dry, timing depends on humidity), then place in incubator at 20Â°C until tracking (at +4 hours on food)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7l2mv","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fegee","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"safety","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"19eqp","text":"Check that worms are crawling (not swimming) on plates, and lawns appear matt in colour (not wet)","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ap44n","text":"30 minutes prior to tracking with the Hydra rig (every 20 minutes, 2 runs in total), remove 5 imaging plates from the 20Â°C incubator and leave to acclimate in the imaging cave.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b2jmv","text":"Record worm behaviour on the bacterial food for 15 minutes at the 4-hour timepoint ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8rcc8","text":"(25 fps, exposure: 25000 msec, blue-light stimulation)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4j99o","text":"After tracking, discard the plates in a biological waste bin","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d2deg","text":"Check tracking checklist to ensure that all videos have been saved correctly: '/Volumes/behavgenom$/Documentation/Protocols/analysis/tracking-checklist-20210210.docx'","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f3shf","text":"Using a multi-pipette, fill all wells of 10 x 96-well culture plates with 200Î¼L LB broth. Fill all wells with 50Î¼g/mL Kanamycin, except for wells designated for BW control strain.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1r84d","text":"(Wednesday)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"532nk","text":"Also inoculate 10mL LB broth media in an Erlenmeyer flask with BW control, and place in a shaking incubator overnight at 37Â°C, 200 rpm","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"don8d","text":"Wet some tissue with MilliQ water, wrap the culture plates in the tissue, and incubate overnight at 37Â°C (no shaking)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1mag9","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4m4eq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"safety","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bgskl","text":"The tissue provides humidity that aids growth, while the presence of Kanamycin should prevent contamination","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eifg","text":"Remove the overnight cultures from the incubators. Using a sterile pipette tip (or inoculation loop), inoculate the wells of the culture plates with strains from the overnight culture vials, as per the desired plate layout. Inoculate the wells with no Kanamycin with the BW control strain. Incubate cultures overnight at 37Â°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1eruk","text":"Remove the antioxidants from 4Â°C. Prepare an empty 96-well plate with 100Î¼L of 10Î¼g/mL antioxidant (in PBS 'A' buffer) in each well as per the desired experiment design layout for antioxidant treatment.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
